messages.subject: Re: tsuba school opinion
messages.msgSnippet: ... Shoami did a lot of that kind of busy nunome, but the sukashi is a bit unusual for them.  More profusely decorated guards with that kind of nunome are
messages.messageBody:
--- In nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com, "Jim Gilbert" <jggilbert@E...>
wrote:
> Milt,
> The plate and the nunome zogan look more like Shoami work. The Awa
Shoami did a lot of that kind of busy nunome, but the sukashi is a bit
unusual for them. More profusely decorated guards with that kind of
nunome are often called Kyo Kenjo. The fukurin might be original.
>
> Kumagai is the correct spelling. Higo style nunome is a bit
different.
>
> Jim
>
>
>
thanks, Jim.

milt

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] tsuba school opinion
messages.msgSnippet: Milt, The plate and the nunome zogan look more like Shoami work.  The Awa Shoami did a lot of that kind of busy nunome, but the sukashi is a bit unusual for
messages.messageBody:
Milt,
The plate and the nunome zogan look more like Shoami work. The Awa Shoami did a lot of that kind of busy nunome, but the sukashi is a bit unusual for them. More profusely decorated guards with that kind of nunome are often called Kyo Kenjo. The fukurin might be original.

Kumagai is the correct spelling. Higo style nunome is a bit different.

Jim

Fox mentioned Shimazu, Mito/Hitachi.

milt
